content.question: A book club wonders if fewer than 40 percent of students at a local university had read at least one book during the last year. To test the claim, the book club selected a random sample of students at the local university and recorded the number of students who had read at least one book during the last year. The club conducted a test with the hypotheses <math alttext="H sub 0: p equals 0.40" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mi>p</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.40</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> versus <math alttext="H sub a: p is less than 0.40" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>a</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mi>p</mi><mo><</mo><mn>0.40</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. The test yielded a <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value of 0.033. Assuming all conditions for inference were met, which of the following is an appropriate conclusion?

choices.label: At the significance level <math alttext="alpha equals 0.01" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>α</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.01</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, the null hypothesis is rejected. There is convincing evidence to support the claim that fewer than 40% of the students at the local university read at least one book last year.

At the significance level <math alttext="alpha equals 0.01" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>α</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.01</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, the null hypothesis is rejected. There is not convincing evidence to support the claim that fewer than 40% of the students at the local university read at least one book last year.

At the significance level <math alttext="alpha equals 0.01" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>α</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.01</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, the null hypothesis is not rejected. There is convincing evidence to support the claim that fewer than 40% of the students at the local university read at least one book last year.

At the significance level <math alttext="alpha equals 0.05" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>α</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.05</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, the null hypothesis is rejected. There is convincing evidence to support the claim that fewer than 40% of the students at the local university read at least one book last year.

At the significance level <math alttext="alpha equals 0.05" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>α</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.05</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, the null hypothesis is rejected. There is not convincing evidence to support the claim that fewer than 40% of the students at the local university read at least one book last year.

content.answer: At the significance level <math alttext="alpha equals 0.05" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>α</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.05</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, the null hypothesis is rejected. There is convincing evidence to support the claim that fewer than 40% of the students at the local university read at least one book last year.

topic.text: 6.6: Concluding a Test for a Population Proportion

skill.text: Skill 4.E: Justify a claim using a decision based on significance tests.
